item.title: BufferUnderFlow
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

veer:

You should probably make sure you’ve received enough data before attempting to read the name-derived part.

Thank you, I incorporated data checks and I believe it’s solved the problem!

item.title: BufferUnderFlow
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

While writing a login decryption system for my framework i’m continuously running into this issue. I’ve been playing around with it for a while now and can’t find a solution. There error is sent on my nameHash. Any Ideas?

public class LoginProtocolDecoder implements CummulativeProtocolDecoder {

    @Override
    public void decode(Client client) {
	try {
	    client.setReader(new StreamBuffer(ByteBuffer.allocate(2000)));
	    client.getChannel().read(client.getReader().getBuffer());
	    client.getReader().flip();
	    int initialByte = client.getReader().readUnsignedByte();
	    if (initialByte != 14) {
		client.getChannel().close();
		System.out.println("[" + client.getChannel() + "] Initial byte wasn't successfully read. [" + initialByte + "]");
		return;
	    } else if (initialByte == 14){
		System.out.println("[" + client.getChannel() + "] Initial byte was successfully read. [" + initialByte + "]");
	    }
	    int nameHash = client.getReader().readUnsignedByte();
	    System.out.println("[" + client.getChannel() + "] The Name Hash/Login Server was successfully read: [" + nameHash + "].");
	} catch (Exception exception) {
	    exception.printStackTrace();
	}
    }
}

Read full topic
